hook.text: What if you could cut drug doses in half and still get relief?

buildup.text: Dose-extending uses conditioning to stretch real medicine.

discovery.text: Patients take a real drug, then swap some doses for placebos.

twist.text: The body responds to the placebo as if it were the real drug.

climax.text: This could reduce side effects and save healthcare costs.

punchline.text: Half the drug, most of the benefit.

quiz.question: How do dose-extending placebos work?
options: They replace some real drug doses after conditioning
They double the strength of each pill
They use hypnosis to reduce pain
